newsitem.title: POLAND: Foreigners spent PLN 11.6 bln in Poland in 1996.
newsitem.headline: Foreigners spent PLN 11.6 bln in Poland in 1996.

text.p: Foreign tourists spent 11.6 billion zlotys on goods and services in Poland last year, 28 percent more than in 1995, the Central Statistical Office (GUS) said on Thursday.
GUS said in a statement that the sum constituted 14.6 percent of Poland's registered exports last year, 0.9 percentage points more than in 1995.
The foreign buyers were mainly interested in clothes, furniture, oil, tobacco products, shoes and confectionery.
The government says that cross-border trade largely offsets Poland's foreign trade deficit, forecast to grow to more than $12 billion this year from $8.2 billion in 1996.
